key_facts: A high-quality, ~15-minute AI-generated video â€” showcasing narrative coherence, visual consistency, and rapid production (<1 week) â€” was publicly shared by creators linked to OpenAI's Sora team
Arav Srinivas (co-creator of Sora) confirmed a related product is 'coming soon'
The demo has drawn significant attention from influential figures including Elon Musk and swyx, signaling industry-level anticipation
analyst_angle: This signals an imminent public or developer-facing release of next-generation open or semi-open AI video generation capabilityâ€”potentially narrowing the gap between Soraâ€™s internal prowess and accessible tools, and escalating competitive pressure on Runway, Pika, and Adobe.

sources.author: Ars Technica
sources.text: The Galaxy S26 is faster, more expensive, and even more chock-full of AI. Samsung's Galaxy S26 series is available for preorder today and ships on March 11.

sources.author: Wired
sources.text: Gemini Can Now Book You an Uber or Order aÂ DoorDash Meal on Your Phone. Hereâ€™s How It Works. Starting with the Samsung Galaxy S26, Googleâ€™s Gemini can automate tasks in popular mobile apps. We got a l

sources.author: Wired
sources.text: Samsung Galaxy S26, S26+, and S26 Ultra: Specs, Features, Price, Release Date. Samsungâ€™s new phones all get AI enhancements, and the flagship Galaxy S26 Ultra has a Privacy Display that can block the

key_facts: Samsung officially launched the Galaxy S26, S26+, and S26 Ultra on February 25, 2026, with preorder starting immediately and shipping March 11
The S26 Ultra features a novel hardware-based Privacy Display using pixel-level control to selectively obscure apps/notifications from side viewers
All models run Qualcomm's Galaxy-centric Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chip and ship with deep Google Gemini integrationâ€”including on-device task automation (e.g., booking Uber, ordering DoorDash)
analyst_angle: This marks a strategic convergence of hardware-level privacy innovation and generative AI agent capabilities in flagship smartphonesâ€”setting a new bar for OEM-AI co-design and potentially accelerating adoption of context-aware, privacy-by-default mobile experiences.

title: ğŸ”¬ NVIDIA Robotics unveils EgoScale: Dexterous humanoid control trained from 20,000+ hours of egocentric human video

sources.author: DrJimFan
sources.text: We trained a humanoid with 22-DoF dexterous hands to assemble model cars, operate syringes, sort poker cards, fold/roll shirts, all learned primarily from 20,000+ hours of egocentric human video with

sources.author: DrJimFan
sources.text:
This is a huge team work at NVIDIA Robotics. Check out @ruijie_zheng12's deep dive: 

- Website: https://t.co/n3Zp8bh8Ht
- Paper: https://t.co/eXQqSl3GHg

https://t.co/ybup5DhSCM

sources.author: _akhaliq
sources.text:
EgoScale

Scaling Dexterous Manipulation with Diverse Egocentric Human Data

paper: https://t.co/pakPMNiaa8 https://t.co/tGRDkn6maM

key_facts: Trained a 22-DoF dexterous humanoid to perform complex manipulation tasks (car assembly, syringe operation, card sorting, shirt folding) using >20,000 hours of egocentric human video â€” no robot-in-the-loop supervision during pre-training
Discovered near-perfect log-linear scaling law (RÂ² = 0.998) between human video volume and action prediction loss, which directly predicts real-robot success rate
EgoScale achieves 54% improvement over scratch training using only 4 hours of robot play data; single teleop demo suffices for zero-shot task generalization
Policy trained on 22-DoF hands transfers effectively to 7-DoF Unitree G1 with 30%+ gains â€” demonstrating embodiment-agnostic scalability
analyst_angle: This redefines the data efficiency frontier in robotics: by treating human video as scalable, embodied 'ground truth', NVIDIA bypasses costly robot-collected data and proprietary sim-to-real pipelines â€” signaling a paradigm shift toward human-centric pre-training as the foundation for general-purpose dexterity.

key_facts: Codex 5.3 achieves 5.3 TOPS (Tasks per Second) in agentic coding, surpassing Opus 4.6 as the new top performer on agentic coding benchmarks
Reported inference speed is 'blazingly fast', with xHigh variant offering premium performance at high cost
Global average score across broader benchmarks still lags behind Opus 4.6 â€” indicating specialization in agentic workflows rather than general capability
analyst_angle: Codex 5.3 signals a strategic pivot toward *agentic efficiency* over holistic intelligence â€” optimizing for task execution speed and autonomy in coding agents, not just static reasoning; this accelerates real-world dev tooling but deepens benchmark fragmentation.

title: ğŸš€ Hermes: Persistent, Self-Improving AI Agent That Runs Locally and Builds Reusable Skills

sources.author: AravSrinivas
sources.text: A financial analyst is a subagent in Perplexity Computer

sources.author: LiorOnAI
sources.text:
Most AI agents are amnesiacs. They solve a problem brilliantly, then forget everything the moment you close the terminal. 

Hermes flips this: it's an agent that writes down what it learns and gets be

sources.author: MLStreetTalk
sources.text: By "agentic applications" I don't mean like on Gmail where you have an agent that can do a few superficial things like searching for email. I mean "agentic-native". Where nearly every single low-level

sources.author: StefanoErmon
sources.text: @jonhillymakes @giffboake Thanks! Yes, dLLMs enable much larger and higher quality agenic flows that still meet latency constraints.

sources.author: StefanoErmon
sources.text: @ejae_dev It does! Of course, when you switch to larger, more complex agent loops, latency starts rising again. But we've pushed out the quality/speed frontier.

key_facts: Hermes is a locally run, persistent AI agent that retains memory and knowledge across sessions
It automatically documents successful problem-solving approaches as searchable, reusable procedural skills
Unlike stateless cloud assistants, Hermes accesses the local filesystem, schedules unattended tasks, spawns subagents, and maintains state across platforms
analyst_angle: Hermes signals a paradigm shift from ephemeral chatbots to compound-learning, infrastructure-native agents â€” potentially redefining enterprise AI tooling, developer workflows, and the competitive moat for AI OS-like platforms.

title: ğŸš€ Amazonâ€™s $50B OpenAI Investment Tied to AGI Milestone or IPO

sources.text:

https://t.co/vS9Xs3wz6A

sources.author: theinformation
sources.text: Deep Research Report: OpenAIâ€™s $100B Stargate supercomputer plan is now a $500B global patchwork. The AI scaling race is as much about power and logistics as money. https://t.co/99JxbhXvyW

sources.author: theinformation
sources.text: OpenAIâ€™s latest projections highlight the central question of the AI era: can scale outrun compute costs? https://t.co/azqMWDwzyK

sources.author: theinformation
sources.text:
AI Agenda: Can Cerebras Chips Help OpenAI Overcome Its $230 Billion Cash Burn?

Read more from @Steph_Palazzolo and @Rocketalignment ğŸ‘‡

key_facts: Amazonâ€™s potential $50 billion investment in OpenAI is conditional on OpenAI achieving AGI or going public
OpenAIâ€™s broader infrastructure ambitionsâ€”exemplified by the scaled-down but still massive Stargate supercomputer planâ€”now imply a $500B global AI hardware/logistics buildout
OpenAI faces extreme capital pressure, with reported $230 billion cumulative cash burn, prompting exploration of alternative chip solutions (e.g., Cerebras) to mitigate compute cost escalation
analyst_angle: This reveals a pivotal shift: hyperscaler capital is no longer unconditionalâ€”itâ€™s now explicitly tied to existential AI milestones, turning AGI timelines and IPO readiness into binding financial triggers that could reshape governance, R&D priorities, and industry consolidation.

title: ğŸš€ Profound Launches AI Agent Platform for Brand Discovery & Autonomous Transactions

sources.author: lightspeedvp
sources.text:
â€œEvery marketer on the planet is going to care about how AI talks about their brand.â€

Discovery, as we know it, is beginning to shift.

This week on The Investment Memo, @tryprofound Co-Founder & CEO

sources.author: lightspeedvp
sources.text:
Profound CEO James Cadwalader on why AI changes everything about how we discover products online:

"If I ask ChatGPT for an insurance quote, the next obvious step is: cool, can you go and buy the insu

key_facts: Profound, co-founded by James Cadwallader and Dylan Babbs, has launched a platform enabling AI agents to discover, navigate, and transact on behalf of users â€” shifting brand visibility from passive search to active agent-driven commerce
The company positions itself as the 'analytics wedge' for Fortune 500 brands adapting to AI-native discovery, with early focus on agentic workflows for marketing and content creation

CEO James Cadwallader articulates a paradigm shift: AI agents (e.g., ChatGPT) are evolving from information retrievers into autonomous purchasing agents â€” requiring brands to optimize not just for SEO, but for agent interoperability, trust, and transaction readiness
analyst_angle: This signals the operationalization of 'AI-native commerce' â€” where discovery, evaluation, and purchase converge in agent workflows, forcing enterprises to treat LLMs and AI agents as first-class distribution and sales channels.

title: ğŸ“œ White House Demands AI Companies Cover Electricity Rate Hikes Amid Data Center Energy Surge

sources.author: TechCrunch
sources.text: The White House wants AI companies to cover rate hikes. Most have already said they would.. Many hyperscalers have already made public commitments to cover electricity cost increases.

sources.author: The Verge
sources.text: Trump claims tech companies will sign deals next week to pay for their own power supply. President Donald Trump tried to quell Americans' concerns about rising electricity costs during his State of th

sources.author: TechCrunch
sources.text: The White House wants AI companies to cover rate hikes. Most have already said they would. https://t.co/igYeAGDz4u

key_facts: The White House is formally urging major AI companies and hyperscalers to absorb electricity cost increases linked to AI data center expansion.
Multiple hyperscalersâ€”including Google, Microsoft, and Metaâ€”have already publicly committed to covering utility rate hikes for their facilities.
Former President Trump claimed (in post-SOTU reporting) that a 'rate payer protection pledge' with tech firms would be finalized next week, framing it as consumer protection against energy inflation.
analyst_angle: This marks the first major U.S. federal policy intervention directly tying AI infrastructure growth to energy cost accountabilityâ€”setting a precedent for regulatory expectations on sustainability, grid impact, and corporate responsibility in the AI era.

title: ğŸ”¬ 'Speeding up AI research on speeding up AI research' â€” Meta's recursive AI R&D framework gains traction

sources.author: jeremyphoward
sources.text: @charles_irl @modal @ScalingIntelLab @HazyResearch @chelseabfinn Thanks for sharing this blog post, which, if it becomes popular and other people learn from it and build on it, will speed up research

sources.author: StefanoErmon
sources.text: @somi_ai That's the idea! (or at least, pushing out the speed/intelligence frontier)

key_facts: Discussion centers on a meta-level AI research methodologyâ€”using AI to accelerate AI research itself
Jeremy Howard highlights a blog post (likely from ScalingIntelLab/HazyResearch) promoting recursive tooling and automation in ML experimentation
Stefano Ermon affirms the goal is pushing the 'speed/intelligence frontier'â€”implying co-advancement of efficiency and capability
analyst_angle: This reflects growing industry consensus that AI's next bottleneck isn't just model scale, but the *velocity* of the R&D loopâ€”automating experimentation, evaluation, and iteration could compress years of progress into months.

title: ğŸ”¬ AI Coding Agents Achieve Breakthrough Operational Coherence (Dec 2024)

sources.author: karpathy
sources.text: It is hard to communicate how much programming has changed due to AI in the last 2 months: not gradually and over time in the "progress as usual" way, but specifically this last December. There are a

sources.author: elonmusk
sources.text:
How to create amazing images with Grok Imagine. 

You can also ask @Grok to generate image and video prompts.

key_facts: Coding agents transitioned from non-functional to reliably operational in December 2024, marked by dramatic improvements in long-term coherence, tenacity, and ability to execute multi-step, end-to-end engineering tasks unassisted

Real-world demonstration: an AI agent autonomously set up a full video analysis stack (SSH, vLLM, Qwen3-VL inference server, web UI, systemd service, documentation) on a DGX Spark â€” requiring research, debugging, iteration, and verification â€” without human intervention
The shift represents a qualitative leapâ€”not incremental progressâ€”rendering traditional keyboard-driven coding workflows increasingly obsolete in well-specified, testable domains
analyst_angle: This is the first widely documented evidence of production-grade agentic autonomy in software engineering; it signals the onset of 'agent-native development', where developer role shifts from author to orchestrator, validator, and abstraction architect â€” with profound implications for dev tooling, education, hiring, and software economics.
